page.title: 08VOICES OF LAUGHARNE
page.content: Population 1007 at the last census, including 380 men, 412 women and 215 children under 16. 210 or 26.5% drawing Old Age Pension. Of these 74 are men over 65 and 136 women over 60. Average of 15 babies born each year. In the past Laugharne had two distinct classes, one of professional or retired shop-keepers and small traders owning their own houses and the other of manual and farm workers, fishermen and women, in rented cottages. The distinction between the two groups has largely disappeared and there are no barriers to social intercourse nowadays. A branch of the Conservative Party in Laugharne hold fund-raising events and address envelopes as does one member of the Ecology (Green) Party. Politics play no part in candidature for any of the tiers of local government.
